passage:
(1) The principal is the leader of a school. The principal makes important decisions about how the school works. They help teachers do their jobs well. The principal also talks to parents about their children.

(2) Every day, the principal has many tasks to do. They check that students are learning well. They make sure the school is safe for everyone. The principal also plans special events for the school. They want all students to enjoy learning.

(3) A good principal listens to others. They talk to teachers about new ways to teach. They listen to students' ideas about the school. The principal also meets with parents to hear what they think. They try to make the school better for everyone.

(4) The principal is like the captain of a ship. They guide the school in the right direction. A good principal helps everyone work together. When a school has a good principal, students learn more and teachers teach better. The principal makes the school a happy place to learn.

options.B: She goes to school every day.
options.C: She going to school every day.
options.D: She goed to school every day.
